derivation: from a compound of G4810 (συκοφαντέω) and a derivative of G5316 (συκοφαντέω);
kjv_def: accuse falsely, take by false accusation
strongs_def: to be a fig-informer (reporter of the law forbidding the exportation of figs from Greece), "sycophant", i.e. (genitive and by extension) to defraud (exact unlawfully, extort)
outline:
1. to accuse wrongfully, to calumniate, to attack by malicious devices
  2. to exact money wrongfully
    1. to extort from, defraud
